title: Find the Derivative of f(x)
text: The derivative of f(x) would be needed approximate $$\sqrt{2}$$ using Newton's method.

title: Modified Newton's Method
text: After finding the derivative of f(x), we can rewrite x_n=x(n-1)-(f(x_n-1)/f'(x_n-1) as $$x_n=\frac{1}{2\left(x_n-1+\frac{2}{x_n}-1\right)}$$. x_n=x(n-1)-(f(x_n-1)/f'(x_n-1) $$=x_n-1-\frac{{x_n}^2-2}{2} x_n-1$$ $$=\frac{1}{2\left(x_n-1\right)}+\frac{1}{x_n}-1$$ $$=\frac{1}{2\left(x_n-1+\frac{2}{x_n}-1\right)}$$

title: Newton's Method With $$n=1$$
text: To find $$x_1$$, use the equation $$x_n=\frac{1}{2\left(x_n-1+\frac{2}{x_n}-1\right)}$$ with $$n=1$$ and $$x_0=2$$.
